smart_goals.description: Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45% of total caloric intake by consuming three balanced meals a day and limiting processed foods and sugary drinks. Aim to maintain this new habit for the next 3 months.

Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes per week, spreading it throughout the week. Choose activities that are enjoyable and can be incorporated into a daily routine, such as brisk walking, cycling, or swimming. Monitor progress weekly.

Take prescribed medication (Metformin 1000mg daily) consistently at the same time each day for the next 3 months. Record medication intake in a journal or use a medication reminder app to ensure adherence.

Monitor and record daily blood glucose levels before meals and at bedtime using a glucometer. Set a target of maintaining pre-meal glucose levels below 130 mg/dL and bedtime levels below 140 mg/dL. Review and adjust medication and diet plans as needed based on weekly trends.

Maintain a food journal to track daily intake of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats, with a focus on consuming a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Set a goal to consume at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables per day. Review and adjust meal plans weekly based on progress towards goals.
